Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2008 08:36PM Kayree wrote: Hi Ladies! Hope you don't mind that I am posting here.  I'm not exactly a Tennessean---but I'm mighty close!  I live in Bristol, VA.  We are a twin city in both VA & TN.  Lived here all my life.  I too am a triple negative girl.  I have finished with tx, but still have to finish up reconstruction, scheduled 9/24 in Johnson City, TN area. Of course still doing follow up care with Onc.  Like many others, I do lots of praying the closer it gets to my follow up visits.  I just pray that all will be well this time.    Bonny, you are right, we do need to stick together and there are some great women on this board.  Even though many of us have a great support group with our families, it's not quite the same as talking to someone who is going through it or has been through it.  Hope everyone has a good week and great weekend!  May God Bless You!  Karen
Posts.Title: Tennessee Thread nelliebelle0361 jenny66

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2010 10:15PM - edited Jan 2, 2010 10:18PM by Kayree I didn't think I needed to have a mammogram after radical mastectomy.  Ultrasound makes more sense to me.  This is a GP who has ordered the mammogram.  I think should probably go to a high risk breast cancer center and see what they recommend.  Thanks for your input!
Posts.Title: Mammography after Mastectomy Kayree mawhinney

Posts.Content: Kayree wrote: I recently started seeing a new GP and now am being advised that I need a mammogram. This has never been recommended by my breast surgeon nor my oncologist. I had a modified mastectomy on one side and a simple mastectomy on the other.  I now have silicone implants.  What are your MDs recommending? Karen Dx 3/2007, IDC, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 1/18 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mammography after Mastectomy Kayree mawhinney
